00010 #ifndef DEBUG_H_
00011 #define DEBUG_H_
00012 
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 
00015 #define DEBUG
00016 
00018 //
00019 // Debug printing verbosity
00020 //
00021 #define DBG_LEVEL   DBG_DEBUG
00022 
00023 // New debug messaging state. There is no sense of a "level" for debugging. Each of these define the
00024 // purpose of the messages and is enabled/disabled per file
00025 #define DBG_ERROR   0           // system cannot continue
00026 #define DBG_CRITICAL 1
00027 #define DBG_WARNING 2           // system is (may be?) consistent, stuff still works (e.g. accept no more domains)
00028 #define DBG_MESSAGE 3
00029 #define DBG_INFO    4           // messages about state or configuration; high-level flow
00030 #define DBG_DEBUG   5           // func args, variable values, etc; full flow, may slow system down
00031 
00032 #define DBG_ERROR_STR "ERROR"
00033 #define DBG_CRITICAL_STR "CRITICAL"
00034 #define DBG_WARNING_STR "WARNING"
00035 #define DBG_MESSAGE_STR "MESSAGE"
00036 #define DBG_INFO_STR    "INFO"
00037 #define DBG_DEBUG_STR   "DEBUG"
00038 
00039 #define printd(level, fmt, args...)                                     \
00040     do {                                                                \
00041         if((level) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00042             printf("<%d> %s[%d]: ", (level), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00043             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00044             fflush(stdout);                                             \
00045         }                                                               \
00046     } while(0)
00047 
00048 // @todo do something like that but smarter without unnecessary copying
00049 #define p_error(fmt, args...)                             \
00050     do {                                                                \
00051         if((DBG_ERROR) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00052             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_ERROR_STR, (DBG_ERROR), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00053             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00054             fflush(stdout);                                                                                     \
00055             exit(-1);                                                                                                   \
00056         }                                                               \
00057     } while(0)
00058 
00059 
00060 #define p_critical(fmt, args...) \
00061         do {                                                                \
00062         if((DBG_CRITICAL) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00063             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_CRITICAL_STR, (DBG_CRITICAL), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00064             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00065             fflush(stdout);                                                                                             \
00066         }                                                               \
00067     } while(0)
00068 
00069 #define p_warn(fmt, args...) \
00070         do {                                                                \
00071         if((DBG_WARNING) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00072             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_WARNING_STR, (DBG_WARNING), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00073             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00074             fflush(stdout);                                                                                             \
00075         }                                                               \
00076     } while(0)
00077 
00078 #define p_mesg(fmt, args...) \
00079         do {                                                                \
00080         if((DBG_MESSAGE) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00081             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_MESSAGE_STR, (DBG_MESSAGE), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00082             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00083             fflush(stdout);                                                                                             \
00084         }                                                               \
00085     } while(0)
00086 
00087 #define p_info(fmt, args...) \
00088         do {                                                                \
00089         if((DBG_INFO) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00090             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_INFO_STR, (DBG_INFO), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00091             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00092             fflush(stdout);                                                                                             \
00093         }                                                               \
00094     } while(0)
00095 
00096 #define p_debug(fmt, args...) \
00097         do {                                                                \
00098         if((DBG_DEBUG) <= DBG_LEVEL) {                                      \
00099             printf("%s <%d> %s[%d]: ", DBG_DEBUG_STR, (DBG_DEBUG), __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);   \
00100             printf(fmt, ##args);                                        \
00101             fflush(stdout);                                                                                             \
00102         }                                                               \
00103     } while(0)

00107 
00109 #define ERROR -1
